ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: If you are looking at this it's because you gotta write your essay. Nothing I say will change that, so go ahead and add it to the worksheet.
How to independently write a paper

This course gave me an opportunity to pursue a long-term research project and to conduct independent reading. I learned a lot about structuring extended papers and managing my progress throughout the semester.
This was truly the capstone of my time at Yale. It was an insane amount of work, but was incredibly worth it on an academic and personal level.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Collin was great, and provided good advice, but I wish there was some more structure and more opportunities to connect with other essay writers. A pooled list of potential second readers would also be helpful!

Strengths- the flexibility 
Weaknesses- the independence
I think there need to be more scheduled meetings with different advisors. Additionally, I think the IRB process should be started in the semester before the thesis is written.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Again, you have to do this (or write an even longer thesis) to graduate. I recommend this course the same way I recommend fulfilling your distributional requirements.
I mean, this is required for EP&E majors, and also exclusive to EP&E majors, so I don't think my recommendation really matters.
